images.copyright: Skier at Bernina Pass, Graubünden, Switzerland (© Francesco Bergamaschi/Getty Images)
images.title: Alpine twists and turns
images.caption: Bernina Pass, Graubünden, Switzerland
images.desc: This awesome white winter expanse is found in the Alps of eastern Switzerland. The famous Bernina Pass stands tall at an elevation of 7,638 feet and attracts winter sports enthusiasts from all over the world. Fun fact: Evidence of the oldest wooden skis, dating back to around 6000 BCE, was found in Russia. Boasting excellent snow conditions from November to March, the Bernina Pass is a must-visit spot on every skier's bucket list.
